sentences.en: A miserly father makes a prodigal son.
sentences.cn: 老子守财奴,儿子败家子.

sentences.en: A prodigal who returns is more precious than gold.
But now her horizon was enlarged by the vision of a prodigal philanthropy.
sentences.cn: 现在她却能用慷慨大度的慈善家的目光来眺望自己广阔的前程.

sentences.en: Even now the vintners are prowling the prodigal vines.
sentences.cn: 看,酒商们正在蓊蓊郁郁的葡萄藤下钻来钻去呢.

sentences.en: He has been prodigal of the money left by his parents.
sentences.cn: 他已挥霍掉他父母留下的钱.

sentences.en: How careless they had been of food then, what prodigal waste!
sentences.cn: 那时他们对于食物是多么不在乎, 多么奢侈浪费啊!

sentences.en: It had the disadvantage of consuming their mutual affections at a fearfully prodigal rate.
sentences.cn: 这种情形也有坏处,因为这就是他们以令人可怕的浪费速度,把他们相互的爱消耗.

sentences.en: Nature is prodigal in variety, but niggard in innovation.
sentences.cn: 自然界虽富于变化却吝于革新.

sentences.en: Nature is prodigal of her gifts.
The genius in his works, in his deeds, is necessarily a prodigal.
sentences.cn: 创作里的天才, 行为上定是个挥霍者.
这些慷慨的施舍必须继续下去.

sentences.en: The prodigal son claimed his birthright early and left home.
sentences.cn: 那个浪子提前把他的遗产要走了,然后离开了家.

sentences.en: You must be prodigal of your offers of power and blankets.
sentences.cn: 不论火药也好,毛毯也好,你一定要毫无吝惜地答应付给.

phrases.tran_cn: n. 悔改的罪人；回头的浪子

trans.tran_cn: 浪费的，铺张的，挥霍的，慷慨的
trans.tran_en: someone who leaves their family and home without the approval of their family, but who is sorry later and returns
someone who spends money carelessly and wastes their time – used humorously

trans.tran_cn: 丰富的，大量的，富于 (of, with)，不吝惜的，十分慷慨的
